department_name: Alameda County Department of Environmental Health

grading_system.description: Numerical scoring system (0-100 points) with color-coded placard display. Each inspection starts with 100 points, violations deduct points based on food safety risk level. Major CDC Risk Factor violations are 2-4 points each, minor violations are 1 point each.

inspection_details.frequency: Risk-based routine inspections conducted on unannounced basis, frequency determined by facility risk assessment
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Conditional pass requires reinspection; imminent health hazards require immediate closure and reinspection for reopening
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Results posted online at Alameda County Department of Environmental Health Online Inspection Results; placards displayed at facilities

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Alameda County Fire Department - Fire Prevention Bureau
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen fire suppression systems require semi-annual inspection and maintenance by qualified professionals per NFPA 96
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual (every 6 months) for kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level inspections conducted by Alameda County DEH (excludes City of Berkeley which has its own health department)
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Alameda County DEH Grading System Ordinance and Penalty Schedule provides local implementation framework

confidence_notes: Found detailed official documentation of the grading system, scoring methodology, and placard system from Alameda County DEH. Verified hybrid numerical/color-coded placard system with specific point deduction structure. Fire department information confirmed through official ACFD website.
verification_notes: All information verified from official Alameda County sources. System uses 100-point scoring with color-coded placards (Green=Pass, Yellow=Conditional Pass, Red=Closed). Major violations worth 2-4 points, minor violations worth 1 point each.
